alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 11:53AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Johnson and east central Washakie Counties through 1230 PM MDT... At 1153 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Big Trails, or 10 miles southeast of Ten Sleep, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Johnson and east central Washakie Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Big Horn Basin
